message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a semi-supervised generative model that learns a joint probability distribution of data and their classes. It is implemented in a typical Wasserstein auto-encoder framework and uses a mixture of Gaussians as a target distribution in latent space. The paper discusses the use of a Gaussian classifier induced by the target distribution and the optimization of the model using Cramer-Wold distance as a maximum mean discrepancy penalty. Based on these characteristics, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision and pattern recognition (cs.CV), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computation and language (cs.CL), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE).
